name: Glacier Hike on Sólheimajökull
description: Guided glacier walk on Sólheimajökull with crampons and ice axes. Walk on ancient ice, see crevasses and ice formations, and learn about glacial geology.
why_recommended: Most accessible glacier hike from Reykjavik; Excellent guides provide all equipment; Suitable for beginners with moderate fitness
what_to_wear: Sturdy hiking boots REQUIRED (ankle support, can rent); Warm layers (it's cold on the ice); Waterproof jacket; NO jeans (cotton kills)
tips: Book 2-3 days ahead in summer. Morning tours are less crowded. They'll turn you away without proper boots.

name: Glacier Hike in Skaftafell
description: Glacier hiking on Falljökull, an outlet of Vatnajökull. More dramatic ice formations than Sólheimajökull. Deeper into the glacier environment.
why_recommended: More impressive ice formations; Vatnajökull (largest glacier in Europe); Better scenery than Sólheimajökull
what_to_wear: Sturdy hiking boots REQUIRED; Warm layers; Waterproof jacket; Gloves recommended
tips: Worth the extra time if you're already at Jökulsárlón. Book ahead in summer.

name: Silfra Snorkeling
description: Snorkel between the tectonic plates in crystal-clear glacial water. 100m+ visibility in water filtered through lava for decades. The only place on Earth you can do this.
why_recommended: Only place to snorkel between continents; 100m visibility; Truly unique experience; Dry suit keeps you warm
what_to_wear: Swimsuit (worn under drysuit); Warm base layers; They provide drysuits and all equipment
tips: You WILL get cold - the drysuit helps but water is 2°C. Hot chocolate after is essential.

name: Silfra Scuba Diving
description: Scuba dive between the tectonic plates. Go deeper into the rift than snorkelers, reaching the bottom of the Silfra Hall. Requires dry suit certification.
why_recommended: Deeper exploration of the rift; Reach Silfra Hall bottom; Fewer people than snorkeling
what_to_wear: Must have dry suit certification and recent diving experience; All equipment provided
tips: Dry suit certification required - book well in advance. Water is 2°C.

name: Whale Watching from Húsavík
description: Traditional oak sailing boat whale watching in Iceland's whale capital. 98% success rate seeing whales. Humpbacks, minkes, and occasionally blue whales.
why_recommended: Highest success rate in Iceland; Traditional wooden boats; Includes warm overalls; Expert guides
what_to_wear: Warm layers under the provided overalls; Waterproof jacket; Hat and gloves
tips: Afternoon tours often have better light. Take seasickness meds if prone - it can be choppy.

name: Whale Watching from Reykjavík
description: Whale watching departing from Reykjavik's old harbor. Convenient if based in the city. Minke whales, dolphins, and occasionally humpbacks.
why_recommended: Convenient departure from city center; Good for tight schedules; Decent success rate
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Waterproof jacket; Comfortable shoes with grip
tips: Success rate lower than Húsavík but still good. Morning tours tend to have calmer seas.

name: Puffin Watching Boat Tour
description: Boat tour to Lundey (Puffin Island) to see thousands of nesting puffins up close. Can often combine with whale watching.
why_recommended: Get close to puffin colonies by boat; Often combined with whale watching; Great for photographers
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Waterproof jacket; Good camera with zoom
tips: Best May-August. Evening tours have most active puffins.

name: Ice Cave Tour
description: Explore naturally-formed ice caves inside Vatnajökull glacier. The blue ice creates an otherworldly atmosphere. Caves change each year.
why_recommended: Stunning blue ice formations; Truly unique experience; Guides know the safest caves
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Sturdy hiking boots (crampons provided); Waterproof jacket
tips: WINTER ONLY (Nov-Mar). Caves melt in summer. Book well ahead - very popular.

name: Snowmobiling on Langjökull
description: Snowmobile across Iceland's second-largest glacier. Stunning views and an adrenaline rush. Year-round activity.
why_recommended: Year-round glacier experience; Thrilling activity; Stunning views; No experience needed
what_to_wear: Warm layers (they provide overalls); Gloves; Good footwear
tips: They provide helmets and suits. Drivers need valid license. Passenger option available.

name: Northern Lights Tour
description: Guided northern lights hunting from Reykjavik. Drivers know the best spots and read forecasts expertly. Includes photography tips.
why_recommended: Expert guides read conditions; Transport to dark sky areas; Multiple rebookings if no lights
what_to_wear: VERY warm layers; Hat, gloves, scarf; Hand warmers; Thermos with hot drink
tips: Sept-March only. Many offer free rebooking if no lights. Check aurora forecast.

name: Raufarhólshellir Lava Tunnel Tour
description: Explore a 5,000-year-old lava tube with stunning rock formations, colors, and ice sculptures in winter. One of Iceland's longest lava tubes.
why_recommended: Easy access from Reykjavik; Dramatic lava formations; Ice sculptures in winter; Suitable for most fitness levels
what_to_wear: Warm layers (cave is cold); Sturdy shoes; They provide helmets and flashlights
tips: Easy 1-hour tour suitable for families. More adventurous options available.

name: Víðgelmir Lava Cave Tour
description: Iceland's largest lava cave with 1.6km of passages. Wooden walkways make it accessible. Impressive formations and colors.
why_recommended: Largest lava cave in Iceland; Accessible walkways; Near Golden Circle; Great formations
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Sturdy shoes; They provide helmets
tips: Combine with Langjökull ice tunnel for underground day.

name: Inside the Volcano Tour
description: Descend into the magma chamber of dormant Þríhnúkagígur volcano via cable lift. The only place on Earth you can enter a magma chamber.
why_recommended: Absolutely unique experience; Only magma chamber you can enter; Stunning colors inside
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Sturdy hiking boots (3km hike to volcano); Waterproof jacket
tips: SUMMER ONLY (May-Oct). Very expensive but genuinely once-in-a-lifetime. Book weeks ahead.

name: Horse Riding Through Lava Fields
description: Ride the unique Icelandic horse through lava fields and volcanic landscapes. Experience the famous 'tölt' gait unique to Icelandic horses.
why_recommended: Iconic Icelandic horses; Famous smooth tölt gait; Suitable for beginners; Beautiful lava scenery
what_to_wear: Long pants; Sturdy shoes (boots provided); Layers for weather
tips: No experience needed. Weight limit usually around 110-120kg. Multiple tour lengths available.

name: River Rafting on Hvítá
description: White water rafting on the glacial Hvítá river near Gullfoss. Class 2-3 rapids suitable for beginners. Beautiful canyon scenery.
why_recommended: Exciting rapids; Glacial river; Near Golden Circle; Suitable for beginners; Hot tub after
what_to_wear: Swimsuit (under drysuit); Change of clothes; They provide all equipment
tips: Cold water but drysuits keep you dry. Hot tub and showers after.

name: ATV Adventure
description: ATV tour through mountain trails and volcanic terrain outside Reykjavik. Get muddy and have fun with stunning scenery.
why_recommended: Adrenaline rush; Great for groups; Mountain and lava scenery; No experience needed
what_to_wear: Clothes that can get dirty; Sturdy shoes; They provide overalls and helmets
tips: Drivers need valid license. Passenger (tandem) options available.

name: Super Jeep Highland Tour
description: Explore Iceland's remote highlands in a modified super jeep. Access places regular cars can't go. Stunning volcanic landscapes.
why_recommended: Access remote highlands; River crossings; Volcanic scenery; Expert driver-guides
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Waterproof jacket; Sturdy shoes; Camera
tips: Full day tour. Highlands only accessible summer. Landmannalaugar is popular destination.

name: Helicopter Tour over Reykjavik
description: Scenic helicopter flight over Reykjavik, mountains, and volcanic terrain. Various routes available including volcano flyovers.
why_recommended: Stunning aerial views; Access to viewpoints impossible otherwise; Various route options
what_to_wear: Comfortable clothes; Camera; Layers (helicopters can be cool)
tips: Weather dependent. Multiple duration options. Volcano tours available.

name: Reykjavik Food Walk
operator: Wake Up Reykjavik / I Heart Reykjavik
description: Guided walking food tour sampling Icelandic cuisine - fermented shark, lamb, seafood, and more. Learn about food culture and city history.
why_recommended: Taste authentic Icelandic foods; Learn food culture; Walking city tour; Great introduction
what_to_wear: Comfortable walking shoes; Come hungry; Weather-appropriate layers
tips: Small groups. Dietary restrictions can often be accommodated with notice.

name: Lava Show
description: Watch real molten lava being poured in a controlled indoor setting. Feel the heat of 1100°C lava up close. Educational and dramatic.
why_recommended: See real molten lava safely; Great for bad weather; Educational; Unique
what_to_wear: Regular clothes; Short-sleeved ok (you'll feel the heat)
tips: Great rainy day activity. Multiple shows daily. Book same day usually fine.

name: Kayaking at Jökulsárlón
description: Kayak among the icebergs at Jökulsárlón glacier lagoon. Get closer to the ice than boat tours allow. Truly immersive experience.
why_recommended: Closest you can get to icebergs; Unique perspective; Small groups; Unforgettable
what_to_wear: Warm layers under provided drysuit; Sturdy shoes
tips: SUMMER ONLY. Very popular - book well ahead. Previous kayaking experience helpful.

name: Ice Climbing
description: Learn ice climbing techniques on Vatnajökull glacier. Includes glacier hiking to the climbing site. No experience necessary.
why_recommended: Learn new skill; Dramatic glacier environment; All equipment provided; Beginner-friendly
what_to_wear: Sturdy hiking boots REQUIRED; Warm layers; Waterproof jacket; Gloves
tips: More challenging than glacier hike. Good fitness required. Book ahead in summer.

name: Zodiac Boat Tour at Jökulsárlón
description: Speed around the glacier lagoon in a zodiac, getting close to icebergs and the glacier face. More exciting than amphibian boats.
why_recommended: Get closer to icebergs; More exciting than big boats; Smaller groups; See glacier face
what_to_wear: Warm layers; Provided flotation suit goes over clothes; Gloves
tips: Books out quickly in summer. Multiple departures daily.

name: Snowmobiling on Mýrdalsjökull
description: Snowmobile on top of the glacier that covers Katla volcano. Year-round activity with stunning views.
why_recommended: Ride above an active volcano; Year-round; Stunning views; Adventure activity
what_to_wear: Warm layers; They provide overalls, helmets, gloves
tips: Meet at base, then super jeep to glacier. Valid driver's license needed.
